thread.title: DeSean Jackson's home in California target of home invasion, robbed
thread.title_full: DeSean Jackson's home in California target of home invasion, robbed

author: azcentral.com
title: DeSean Jackson's home in California target of home invasion, robbed
text:
Los Angeles police confirmed that a home invasion and robbery occurred at the home of Washington Redskins wide receiver DeSean Jackson in Tarzana, Calif.
Jackson was not home at the time of the incident, but there were five adults in the house when four armed males broke in early in the morning of Oct. 21, detective Tracey Angeles of the LAPD’s West Valley Division told USA TODAY Sports.
TMZ first reported the incident Friday morning.
One of the occupants of the home was injured in the attack while fighting off the intruders, Angeles said.
A law enforcement official with knowledge of the investigation told USA TODAY Sports that the occupant is a music produce and that he was "pistol whipped." The official request anonymity because they were not authorized to talk publicly about the investigation.
The official said the incident is being investigated as a gang crime and that LAPD is in possession of video footage from the house.
Angeles said suspects have not yet been identified.
“We’re following up on every lead we have,” Angeles said.
Jackson, a Los Angeles native, is currently with his team in Virginia. Jackson has not played since the season opener on Sept. 13 because of a nagging hamstring injury. He has no catches this season.
“He’ll get to the bottom of it, as will the police, and we’ll go from there,” Washington head coach Jay Gruden said Friday morning.
In an interview with ESPN The Magazine last year, Jackson admitted that he still associated with people in gangs that he knew from his youth, but that he was not in, nor ever had been, in a gang.
Contributing: A.J. Perez
Follow Lindsay H. Jones on Twitter @bylindsayhjones
